alert.note: Alert for Montezuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 8:34PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Colorado, including the following county, Montezuma. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 833 PM MDT, satellite and lightning data indicate heavy rain from thunderstorms in the advisory area surrounding Towaoc. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Navajo Wash, Ute Canyon, Mariano Wash, Cowboy Wash, East Mc Elmo Creek, Aztec Wash, Chimney Rock Draw, Coyote Wash, Mc Elmo Creek, Mud Creek, Marble Wash and Fisher Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Towaoc.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
